inkball

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.Line

  • public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
    The Line class represents a user-drawn line in the game. A line is composed of multiple line segments and is drawn on the screen using these segments. Lines can interact with balls in the game, and can be removed upon collision with a ball.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line()
      Constructor to create a new empty line.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSegment(LineSegment segment)
      Adds a new segment to the line.
      void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
      Draws the entire line on the screen, by iterating through all the segments and rendering them on the game window.
      java.util.List<LineSegment> getSegments()
      Retrieves the list of segments that make up the line.
      boolean isCollidingWithBall(Ball ball)
      Check if the line is colliding with the ball.
      void removeLineIfCollidingWithBall(Ball ball, java.util.List<Line> lines)
      Remove the line from the list of lines if it is colliding with the ball.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line()
        Constructor to create a new empty line. The line consists of multiple segments that can be added using the addSegment method.

    • Method Detail

      • addSegment

        public void addSegment(LineSegment segment)
        Adds a new segment to the line. Segments represent individual parts of the line.
        Parameters:
        segment - The line segment to be added to the line.

      • getSegments

        public java.util.List<LineSegment> getSegments()
        Retrieves the list of segments that make up the line.
        Returns:
        The list of line segments.

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
        Draws the entire line on the screen, by iterating through all the segments and rendering them on the game window.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet object used to draw the line.

      • isCollidingWithBall

        public boolean isCollidingWithBall(Ball ball)
        Check if the line is colliding with the ball.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball to check for collision with the line.
        Returns:
        True if the line is colliding with the ball, false otherwise.

      • removeLineIfCollidingWithBall

        public void removeLineIfCollidingWithBall(Ball ball,
                                          java.util.List<Line> lines)
        Remove the line from the list of lines if it is colliding with the ball.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball to check for collision with the line.
        lines - The list of lines from which the line should be removed.
